content:
New research suggests as many as one in three live paycheque to paycheque

AS AMERICA’S partial government shutdown enters its 33rd day, the roughly 800,000 federal workers affected by the closure are facing growing financial pressures. Some are looking for temporary work or applying for unemployment insurance. Others are seeking help from charities or crowdfunding websites such as GoFundMe. Still others are seeking financial assistance from pawnbrokers and payday lenders, whose share prices have soared since federal funding to about a quarter of the government lapsed on December 22nd. President Donald Trump insists that those impacted by the shutdown, which could last “months or even years” by his reckoning, will “make adjustments”. But how?

Another paper about the 2013 shutdown by Michael Gelman of Claremont McKenna College and four colleagues yields similar conclusions. The authors find that a surprisingly high share of federal workers live paycheque to paycheque, with about a third having virtually no cash in their bank accounts on payday. When the shutdown began in 2013, and workers suddenly had less money coming in, many responded by delaying mortgage payments or carrying higher balances on their credit cards. They also spent less: for every dollar of lost income, spending fell by $0.58.

The current shutdown, now the longest in history, is likely to have more serious consequences. Economists at Moody’s, a rating agency, reckon that for every week workers stay home, GDP growth falls by 0.04 percentage points. The White House’s Council of Economic Advisors says the effect may be three times as big, which suggests that the economy has already taken a hit of half a percentage point. Jamie Dimon, the boss of JPMorgan Chase, recently warned that if the shutdown lasts through the first quarter, it could reduce growth to zero. The irony of course, is that we will not know the economic impact of the shutdown for some time. The agency that produces America’s GDP figures has been shuttered for over a month.

而且，视频中有一部分的时间流逝从本质上导致了那些云看起来像是在跳跃着，以一种陌生的方式出现。

Title: American government workers are feeling the shutdown’s financial impact

paperStatistics.title: American government workers are feeling the shutdown’s financial impact
paperStatistics.desc: New research suggests as many as one in three live paycheque to paycheque
